intro: Gillenia stipulata var. virgata, commonly known as white gillenia, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It features showy, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, rich soils and is often found in woodlands or along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and wetland restoration projects.
